body_html: It's not CMake, it's not even ATen. It's just setuptools/distutils that is dumb and doesn't track modifications in files other than those listed in setup.py explicitly (even if they are included), and if it finds that once file has to be rebuild it will still rebuild everything. Use rm -rf build && python setup.py build_deps develop (note build_deps instead of build so you don't waste your time). I'd say this is a wontfix, unless you want to spend hours fiddling with setuptools internals.

body: It's not CMake, it's not even ATen. It's just setuptools/distutils that is dumb and doesn't track modifications in files other than those listed in `setup.py` explicitly (even if they are included), and if it finds that once file has to be rebuild it will still rebuild everything. Use `rm -rf build && python setup.py build_deps develop` (note `build_deps` instead of `build` so you don't waste your time). I'd say this is a wontfix, unless you want to spend hours fiddling with setuptools internals.
